ca.mcgill.ecse211.captureflag

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • ca.mcgill.ecse211.captureflag.Navigation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Thread
    The Navigation class implements the logic of moving from one point to another, using the shortest path.

      • run

        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(double x,
                     double y)
        This method causes the robot to travel to the absolute field location (x, y) ,specified in tile points.This method should continuously call turnTo(double theta) and then set the motor speed to forward(straight). This will make sure that your heading is updated until you reach your exact goal. This method will pool the odometer for information.
        Parameters:
        x - The new x destination of the robot
        y - The new y destination of the robot

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo(double theta)
        This method takes an angle theta as input. It starts by setting the speed of both motors. The angle is between -360 and 360 degrees, but since this methods should always make the robot turn with the minimum angle possible, theta should be updated. If theta is greater than 180 degrees, instead of turning positively, the robot turns negatively by an angle of theta - 360. And if theta is less than or equal to -180, instead of turning negatively, the robot turns positevly by an angle of theta + 360.
        Parameters:
        theta - The angle by which the cart should turn.
